reference.shortdesc: A message block is a multi-line message or set of messages that is produced by an application or device.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The msgblock element can contain multiple message numbers and message descriptions, each enclosed in msgnum and msgph elements. It can also contain the message content directly.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: Processors SHOULD preserve the line breaks and spaces that are present in the content of a msgblock element.
The content of the msgblock element is typically rendered in a monospaced font.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The msgblock element is specialized from pre. It is defined in the software domain module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , , and xml:space.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows a msgblock element that contains a multi-line message that is returned by an application:
example.codeblock:
A sequence of failed password attempts generates the following message stream:

I:0 S:3 I:1 S:3 I:1 S:4 S:99 (lockup)
